step.context: \text{Which of the following is more helpful to}\\ \text{get the ball rolling?}
step.tex: \int \left(\sin^{-1} x\right)^2 .dx = \int \left(\sin^{-1} x\right)\left(\sin^{-1} x\right).dx\\ \therefore \text{let }f \left(x\right) = \sin^{-1} x \text{ and }g \left(x\right) = \sin^{-1} x

step.context: \text{If I is re-written in terms of }\phi\text{, then is this}\\ \text{what it will be?}
\text{Given }I = \int \phi^2 . \cos \phi .d\phi,\text{ which would be the}\\ \text{better choice for f and g in}\\ I = f \int g.dx - \int \left[f^{\prime}\int g.dx \right].dx
step.reason: \text{There is a good thumb rule }\textemdash \text{ called ILATE}\\ \text{that you can use.}f \left(x\right) \text{ is the function that}\\ \text{matches first.}\\ \begin{tabular}{|C|C|C|C|} \hline I & \text{Inverse trigonometric}& \textemdash\\ L & \text{Logrithmic } &\textemdash \\ A & \text{Algebric } & \phi^2 & -f \left(x\right)\\ T & \text{Trigonometic } & \cos \phi& - g \left(x\right)\\ E & \text{Exponential } & \textemdash\\ \hline \end{tabular}

step.context: \text{Is the following the value of I when expressed }\\ \text{in terms of x?}
